seo.title: Nano Banana – Photoreal Image Generation | MaxVideoAI
seo.description: Generate photoreal stills and edits with Nano Banana. Text-to-image and image-to-image for keyframes, thumbnails, and references before you animate in Sora, Veo, or Kling.

overview: Nano Banana is your photoreal image sidekick in MaxVideoAI. Lock style, lighting, and framing before you render video—text-to-image plus image edits from the same wallet and prompt lab.

hero.title: Nano Banana – Photoreal Image Generation
hero.intro: Generate on-brand stills, keyframes, and product shots before you hit Render. Nano Banana is the image sidekick for Sora, Veo, Kling, and the rest of the stack.

bestUseCases.title: Best use cases
items: Brand-style keyframes for Sora and Veo

technicalOverview.label: Input types
technicalOverview.body: Text prompts, reference images (JPG/PNG/WebP), and edit mode for restyles or cleanups.

technicalOverview.label: Outputs
technicalOverview.body: High-res still images tuned for photorealism and text legibility.

technicalOverview.label: Modes
technicalOverview.body: Text-to-image; image-to-image for restyle, cleanup, and background replacement.

technicalOverview.label: Typical use
technicalOverview.body: Prepare 1–4 keyframes before animating in Sora, Veo, Kling, or Wan.

promptStructure.title: Prompt mini-guide
promptStructure.description: Keep prompts descriptive and grounded. Mention subject, setting, lens, lighting, and how you’ll use the frame.

tips.title: Tips & limits
items: Generate 2–4 keyframes, then animate them in Veo/Sora/Kling.
Use edit mode to clean dust, even lighting, or replace backgrounds.
Lock seeds for consistency across a series.

prompts.title: Product hero (text → image)
prompts.prompt: Photoreal studio product shot of a wireless earbud on a dark glossy surface, soft rim light, minimal background, 8K, product photography.

prompts.title: Lifestyle keyframe (text → image)
prompts.prompt: Warm lifestyle scene of a young professional working on a laptop by a big window at golden hour, soft bokeh city lights outside, realistic colours, cinema-grade lighting.

prompts.title: Cleanup (image → image)
prompts.prompt: Clean up this product mockup: even out the lighting, remove dust and fingerprints, and place it on a soft gradient background suitable for e-commerce.

prompts.title: Magazine restyle (image → image)
prompts.prompt: Using this portrait photo, match the look of a glossy magazine cover: smoother skin, slightly punchier contrast, subtle colour grading and a neutral studio backdrop.

faqs.q: Is Nano Banana for images or video?
faqs.a: Images. Use it to prep photoreal references, thumbnails, and keyframes before sending shots to video engines like Sora or Veo.
Set `num_images` to 1–8. Batch a few variants, then reuse a seed to stay consistent.
No masks needed. Upload a clean still and describe the transformation (cleanup, background swap, relight).

pricingNotes: Live pricing updates inside the workspace. Check the chip before you render.

custom.heroDesc1: Generate photoreal stills and edits to lock style, lighting, and framing before you animate in Sora, Veo, or Kling.
custom.heroDesc2: Text-to-image and image-to-image share the same wallet and prompt lab as your video engines, with 1–8 outputs per run.
heroHighlights: Text → Image and Image → Image in one lab
Great for local edits: cleanup, relight, background replacement, small prop tweaks
1–8 outputs per run with seeds for consistency
Wallet-based pricing shared with video engines; no separate Nano Banana account needed
custom.whatTitle: How Nano Banana works in MaxVideoAI
custom.whatIntro1: Choose text-to-image or image-to-image, set the batch size (1–8), write your prompt or edit instructions, and generate.
custom.whatIntro2: Use it to lock style, lighting, and framing before animating in video engines.
whatFlowSteps: Open the Image lab with Nano Banana selected
Pick Text → Image or Image → Image
Set num_images (1–8) and seed if you need consistency
Add your prompt; for edits, upload a clean reference
Check the live price chip and generate
custom.galleryIntro: Recent photoreal stills and edits used as keyframes for video workflows.
custom.promptIntro: Describe subject, lighting, lens, and how you’ll use the frame. For edits, spell out the transformation.
promptPatternSteps: Mood and composition (hero angle, clean background)
custom.promptSkeleton: Photoreal [subject] in/on [environment/surface], lit by [lighting], shot on [lens/look], clean background for [use case].
custom.promptSkeletonNote: For edits: “Clean up / restyle this image: [instructions].”
strengths: Fast photoreal stills for keyframes and thumbnails
Edit mode for cleanup, relight, and background swaps
Batch 1–8 outputs, reuse seeds for consistency
boundaries: Image-only; use video engines for motion
One prompt per batch; keep instructions concise
No audio or video inputs in this route
custom.promptingTitle: How to Write a Great Nano Banana Prompt
custom.promptingIntro: Describe the subject, composition, lighting, and style in clear, concrete terms.
custom.promptingTip: Tip: resolution + aspect ratio are set in the UI — your prompt controls subject, composition, lighting, style, and mood.
promptingGlobalPrinciples: Describe the subject, composition, and lighting clearly.
Use visual anchors (specific nouns > vague adjectives).
Iterate: change one thing at a time.
custom.tipsIntro: Image generation is most predictable when you keep the frame simple, readable, and physically grounded.
promptingEngineWhy: Keep prompts focused: one subject, one action, one camera angle.
Use concrete visual anchors (props, textures, lighting cues).
Iterate by changing a single variable per take.

promptingTabNotes.quick: Quick = variations. Use for fast iteration.
promptingTabNotes.structured: Structured = consistency. Use when you need reliable results.
promptingTabNotes.pro: Pro = style control. Use for precise, repeatable looks.

promptingTabs.label: Quick
promptingTabs.title: Quick prompt (fast iteration)
promptingTabs.description: Use 1–2 sentences when you want variations.

promptingTabs.label: Structured
promptingTabs.title: Structured prompt (best for reliable results)
promptingTabs.description: Separate information so the model can follow it consistently.
promptingTabs.copy:
Subject:
[Who/what + 1 clear action or pose.]

Setting:
[Where + time of day + 2–3 visual anchors.]

Composition:
- Framing: [wide / medium / close-up]
- Angle: [eye-level / low / high]
- Lens feel: [e.g., 35mm natural, shallow DOF]

Lighting + palette:
[Key light + 2–3 palette anchors]

Style constraints:
No logos. No readable text. Clean background.

promptingTabs.label: Pro
promptingTabs.title: Pro prompt (ultra-specific "studio brief")
promptingTabs.description: Use this when you need a very specific look or continuity across shots.
promptingTabs.copy:
Project / intent:
[One-line goal for the still.]

Subject:
[Who/what + wardrobe/materials + 2–3 distinctive traits.]

Location / set:
[Where + time of day + weather. Add 3 visual anchors.]

Composition:
- Framing + angle
- Lens feel + depth of field
- Look: [clean digital / subtle film grain / soft bloom]

Lighting & grade:
- Key light
- Contrast
- Palette anchors (3–5)

Constraints:
No logos. No readable text. No overlays.
